body.name: HP DeskJet 2734e Wireless Color All-in-One Printer with 3 Months Free Ink (26K72A), White
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
features: 3MONTHS FREE INK when you activate HP+ – Includes 3 months free subscription for Instant Ink delivery service with HP+ activation. Ink ships automatically so you never run out. After 9 months, monthly fee applies unless cancelled, and you save up to 50%.

INCLUDES FREE HP+ SMART FEATURES – Activate HP+ free to get advanced features for mobile printing, security, automatic updates and more. HP+ only works with an HP account, internet connection and Original HP Ink for the life of the printer.
BEST FOR BASIC PRINTING – Print basic color documents like recipes, forms and travel documents
KEY FEATURES – Print, copy and scan in color, mobile fax, plus mobile and wireless printing
EASY SETUP – Get started fast on any device with the HP Smart app that guides you step by step
HP SMART APP – Print, scan and copy from your phone—from anywhere. Get additional advanced features with HP+.
WORRY-FREE WIRELESS – Get better range and more reliable connections using dual-band Wi-Fi with self-reset

This printer is intended to work only with cartridges with original HP chips or circuitry and will block cartridges using non-HP chips or circuitry. Periodic firmware updates will maintain the effectiveness of these measures. More at www.hp.com/learn/ds.
body.description: The HP DeskJet 2734e has the essential features you need to print basic color documents like recipes and forms. Print, copy and scan with ease, print from your phone, mobile fax and get easy setup. It includes the optional HP+ Smart Printing System that keeps itself up to date and ready to print from virtually anywhere at any time—at no additional cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Little slow but it works! Great value for the money.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use I really like the app for the printer when printing from my phone. Scanner works great, colors are very detailed for the price I was expecting a piece of junk but it exceeded my expectations picture quality is above average only thing that’s minority inconvenient is the print speed but it works!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great little printer for my off and on daily needs. Easy to set up, feels quality built and the price is definitely right...so much so that I'm seriously considering buying a spare one as soon as Amazon has another supply in stock. I really love it. Very happy,

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars NOT FANFIC FRIENDLY
reviews.reviewText: this is a great little printer. But I bought it for binding fanfics. Yall I'm on day three and I'm only 3.5 signatures in. does not do double side print so I have to do it manually and you can't do groups of pages at once cause it will cut off in a middle of a page. So I am literally printing 200 pages one page at a time. Also it does not like to maintain wifi connection. I am currently writing this while I wait for connection again. Also I'm on my 3rd ink cart. Just spring for the $80 HP if you are doing fanfic. At this point I never want to read Breath mints and Battle scars ever again let alone bind it lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price and does the job!
reviews.reviewText: I needed a printer for my house and this was just the one. I didn't want it to break the bank and I also didn't need it to be super complicated. The setup was pretty easy if you do it through the app on your phone. Once it was hooked up to my Wi-Fi, it has been golden ever since. I can print right from my iPhone now and it's made life really easy and convenient when I need to print something last minute.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality all in one
reviews.reviewText: I don't print all that much but have found this is a great quality all in one at a reasonable price for a printer

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Landmines.......everywhere.Short take based on my short time using; printing only, haven't tried scan or fax yet...Print quality is excellent.B/W document photocopies also excellent.Setup: using the most current version of windows 10, when I used the windows settings to "add printer" it recognizes the printer but comes back with "no drivers available".You can either go do a manual search for drivers or will have to load the "HP Smart" app onto your computer to employ this printer, well, I did anyway.I'm not a tech genius, but I did used to do tech support for a Savings and Loan as well as a Credit Union software vendor that provides about 85% of the nations credit unions their operating system software.Parts of the HP smart setup were easy; parts were so unhelpful, so NOT intuitive that I wondered if I'd ever get the printer to print.First, it demands that you start the printer with the HP ink cartridges that come with the printer.Although I *bought* this printer, as a Vine reviewer, I had ordered some generic HP 67XL cartridges that came the day before this did.I wanted to just save the HP's and use the Vine ordered cartridges so that I could write a review for those.Rabbit trail, and you already know this: THIS PRINTER, LIKE ALL, IS ABOUT THE INK, NOT THE PRINTER.After installing the HP cartridges, HP - not that smart, wanted to align the print heads.Click the button in the app and....nothing for a very long time.Finally it printed one page, but the app stayed stuck on "printer alignment not finished" (not a direct quote).Here's why....after printing the alignment page, you also need to scan the page that shows the alignment to complete the alignment process.Wifi: one of the best/easiest things about this printer; found and connected well and stayed connected, and once it was finally in the mood, printed the documents very nicely."WORRY-FREE WIRELESS – Get better range and more reliable connections using dual-band Wi-Fi with self-reset".Would *anyone* read in to that, that NO, you will not be able to connect this printer via a simple cable in order for it to work??? I seriously doubt it.I posted inaccurate information in this review, and this is the corrected update, with that info deleted....There is a cable usb port on the back of the printer.First though, the printer MUST be set up using only wifi.After being set up on wifi, you can connect a USB cable, *but* the printer *must* continue to be connected to wifi.Back to the ink: the product page said 9 months free with signup (consider declining) the app and the box mine came in offered 2 months.Landmine: To participate you will need to agree NOT to use generic cartridges.Landmine: Agreeing to have automatic printer/software updates could disable the printers ability to recognize and use your generic ink cartridges. You can select NOT to have automatic updates.Each time I installed and tested generic HP cartridges, immediately a separate HP window opened wanting to update the HP software. I can't help suspect that it would have installed an update right then and there to disable that set of generic cartridges, so be careful about agreeing to updates if you intend to use or have installed new generic cartridges.I'm sure the "rationale" from their marketing department would go something like..."To assure the longevity of the printer lifespan and the quality of printing, we have updated the software to reject non compliant ink cartridges....blah, blah, blah"It's about income stream, not their concern about how long a $40.00 printer lives.Really, as I said, it's like it's THEIR printer, not yours.But wait, there's more.When you say "All in One" and suggest that includes the ability to fax, would you suspect that, no, the machine itself really won't fax for you, instead the app will. Okay...No. Not Okay; it becomes a PAID function at that point and after a trial period, you will need to provide payment information and pay for the fax function.To me, these many little omissions of transparency border on inviting a class action lawsuit.The initial and current 3 star rating is not based on long term use.As new, this prints a nice page (using both theirs and the generic ink).4 stars for print quality and appearance of quality of printer.1 star for "landmines".As I haven't bought a printer for a while, I suspect this kind of behavior is industry standard now; but that doesn't make it right or okay.I'm averaging the overall to 3 based on my experience.I hope this review has been helpful and enables you to make an informed purchase decision.I rarely give an overall 5 star rating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set up!
reviews.reviewText: It's perfect for my little home office! It was easy to set up and I use it just about every day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price, only prints one-sided
reviews.reviewText: Great value for the price and does the job I need. My biggest issue is that I didn't realize it only prints one-sided. Not too big of a deal, you can always change your print options to odd pages only, flip it over, and print even only. Just be careful that everything is in the right order and facing the right direction. Definitely would not recommend if you need to print a lot, but a few pages every now and then, it works great.
works greateasy to usedecent print quality

Set up was quick and easy and i can print directly from my phone or computer wirelessly.I'm not sure if activating HP+ was the best decision. Basically for 3 months i can print up to 700 pages/month. after which i would need to subscribe to a ink plan and payment is now per page not per cartridge. If i cancel the subscription the cartridge would deactivate and i'd need to buy a genuine HP cartridge from the store.However i wonder if it would have been better not to activate and just directly shop offbrand.
printer works perfectly,connected to server easily able to print and scan variety
Easy to set up, and comes with ink, all around I'm really pleased with how it turned out.

reviews.reviewTitle: This printer is a piece of garbage
reviews.reviewText: I just got this printer 3 weeks ago used it once it will no longer connect to our wifi I have reset it(hold the power and wifi button) tried that about 30 times, nothing happened the wifi icon is still just flashing, there’s is no contact information for returns, we home school and it’s very frustrating not being able to print and scan when we need it now my child is going to be another week or 2 behind because this printer is a piece of garbage, and have to drive to a city to go and get a different one,
